content:
Hi, I am new to Lean4 and I am sorry that I have a simple question.
After googling, I still can't solve it.
My lean4-vscode-plugin is reporting "unknown package 'Mathlib'".
I have followed the instructions below:

$ lake new usemathlib4
$ cd usemathlib4
$ lake init usemathlib4 math
$ lake update
$ lake build

Now I cannot determine if the code written in usemathlib4 is correct.
The only way I can determine if the code written in usemathlib4 is correct is import those code to Usemathlib4.lean and lake build.
I am so sorry to ask this simple question....
If lake build already works with the import, you may simply be missing the step of opening the project using File > Open Folder in VS Code

Arthur Paulino said:

Please try these instructions: https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4#using-mathlib4-as-a-dependency

Thanks for your reply. I followed those instructions. It works for I can import mathlib4 in <project name>.lean but my vscode still reports "unknown package 'Mathlib'" because vscode cannot find the object file of mathlib4. I think there is a step missing to let vscode know where these object files are.

Sebastian Ullrich said:

If lake build already works with the import, you may simply be missing the step of opening the project using File > Open Folder in VS Code

Yes! Forgive my stupidity. Thanks for all your help. Have a good day.
Scott Morrison has marked this topic as resolved.
